coapthon2.messages package¶

Submodules¶

coapthon2.messages.message module¶

class coapthon2.messages.message.Message[source]¶

Bases: object

Manage messages.

acknowledged[source]¶

Checks if is this message has been acknowledged.

Returns:True, if is acknowledged
add_option(option)[source]¶

Add an option to the message.

Parameters:option (coapthon2.messages.option.Option) – the option
Raises TypeError:
 if the option is not repeatable and such option is already present in the message
cancelled[source]¶

Checks if this message has been canceled.

Returns:True, if is canceled
del_option(option)[source]¶

Delete an option from the message

Parameters:option (coapthon2.messages.option.Option) – the option
del_option_name(name)[source]¶
duplicated[source]¶

Checks if this message is a duplicate.

Returns:True, if is a duplicate
static new_ack(message)[source]¶

Create a new acknowledgment for the specified message.

Parameters:message – the message to acknowledge
Returns:the acknowledgment
static new_rst(message)[source]¶

Create a new reset message for the specified message.

Parameters:message – the message to reject
Returns:the rst message
options[source]¶

Property for retrieving the options of the message.

Returns:the options
rejected[source]¶

Checks if this message has been rejected.

Returns:True, if is rejected
timeouted[source]¶

Checks if this message has timeouted. Confirmable messages in particular might timeout.

Returns:True, if has timeouted

coapthon2.messages.option module¶

class coapthon2.messages.option.Option[source]¶

Bases: object

Represent a CoAP option.

length[source]¶

Get the len of the option value

Returns:the len of the option value
number[source]¶

Get the option number.

Returns:the option number
raw_value[source]¶

Get the option value.

Returns:the option value as BitArray
value[source]¶

Get the option value.

Returns:the option value as bytes

coapthon2.messages.request module¶

class coapthon2.messages.request.Request[source]¶

Bases: coapthon2.messages.message.Message

Represent a Request message.

accept[source]¶

Get the Accept option of a request.

Returns:the Accept value or None if not specified by the request
content_type[source]¶

Get the Content-Type option of a request.

Returns:the Content-Type value or None if not specified by the request
etag[source]¶

Get the ETag option of a request.

Returns:the ETag values or [] if not specified by the request
has_if_match[source]¶

Check if the request has the If-Match option.

Returns:True, if the request has the If-Match option.
has_if_none_match[source]¶

Check if the request has the If-None-Match option.

Returns:True, if the request has the If-None-Match option.
if_match[source]¶

Get the If-Match option of a request.

Returns:the If-Match values or [] if not specified by the request
observe[source]¶

Check if the request is an observing request.

Returns:0, if the request is an observing request
query[source]¶

Get the Uri-Query of a request.

Returns:the Uri-Query
uri_path[source]¶

Get the Uri-Path of a request.

Returns:the Uri-Path

Bases: coapthon2.messages.message.Message

Returns:the ETag values or [] if not specified by the response

Returns:the Location-Path
location_query[source]¶

Get the Location-Query option of a response.

Returns:the Location-Query
max_age[source]¶

Get the Max-Age option of a response.

Returns:the Max-Age value or 0 if not specified by the response

Returns:the Observe value
